intro: Dichaetanthera calodendron, commonly known as the white-barked tree, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its distinctive white bark and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and it has a woody stem with a smooth, peeling surface. Its leaves are alternate and trifoliate, with three leaflets that are elliptical in shape. The plant is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
